com.cavetale.dirty

Class Dirty

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cavetale.dirty.Dirty

  • public final class Dirty
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to get or set item, entity, or block NBT data. Items may be accessed directly; for the other two one has to load, modify, store.

    • Method Detail

      • fromTag

        public static java.lang.Object fromTag(NBTBase value)
        Turn an NBT into a corresponding Container object. Works recursively on Compounds and Lists.
        Parameters:
        value - The NBT value.
        Returns:
        value A raw value, such as Number, Boolean, String, Array, List, Map.

      • toTag

        public static NBTBase toTag(java.lang.Object value)
        Turn any JSON object into an NBT. Workd recursively on Maps and Lists.
        Parameters:
        value - The raw value, such as Number, Boolean, String, Array, List, Map.
        Returns:
        An NBT structure.

      • getItemTag

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getItemTag(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack bukkitItem)
        Get an item's tag in container form, that is, transformed from NBT to Java language objects, ready to be saved as JSON or modified.

      • serializeItem

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> serializeItem(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack bukkitItem)
        Completely serialize an item, including `id` and `Count`. The result will be ready to be saved to JSON or deserialized, see below.

      • setItemTag

        public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack setItemTag(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack bukkitItem,
                                                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> json)
        This will return a new instance if `bukkitItem` is not an instance of of CraftItemStack, and possibly for other reasons. To avoid that, create the ItemStack with one of the methods below, or retrieve them from a running Minecraft server. In other words, do not just use the result of ItemStack::new.

      • setNBT

        public static java.util.Optional<java.lang.Object> setNBT(java.util.Optional<java.lang.Object> opt,
                                                          java.lang.String key,
                                                          java.lang.Object value)
        Set a key-value pair in a compound. This will wrap the value in the approproate NBTBase subclass.
        Parameters:
        opt - Optional wrapping NBTTagCompound.
        key - The key.
        value - The raw value, such as Number, Boolean, String, Array, List, Map.
        Returns:
        The created NBT value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if opt does not wrap an NBTTagCompound.

      • setNBT

        public static java.util.Optional<java.lang.Object> setNBT(java.util.Optional<java.lang.Object> opt,
                                                          int index,
                                                          java.lang.Object value)
        Set a value at an index in an NBT list. This will wrap the value in the approproate NBTBase subclass.
        Parameters:
        opt - Optional wrapping NBTTagList.
        index - The index.
        value - The raw value, such as Number, Boolean, String, Array, List, Map.
        Returns:
        The created NBT value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if opt does not wrap an NBTTagList.

      • addNBT

        public static java.util.Optional<java.lang.Object> addNBT(java.util.Optional<java.lang.Object> opt,
                                                          java.lang.Object value)
        Append a value to an NBT list. This will wrap the value in the approproate NBTBase subclass.
        Parameters:
        opt - Optional wrapping NBTTagList.
        value - The raw value, such as Number, Boolean, String, Array, List, Map.
        Returns:
        The added NBT value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if opt does not wrap an NBTTagList.

      • fromNBT

        public static java.lang.Object fromNBT(java.util.Optional<java.lang.Object> opt)
        Turn an Optional wrapping any NBTBase subclass into a Java value, ready to be stored as JSON or modified.
        Parameters:
        opt - Optional wrapping NBTBase subclass.
        Returns:
        The Java contained Object or null.
